title: Russia, Iran and the fast track to a new world order
summary: Because of Western sanctions, Moscow is redirecting its exports to Asian and Gulf countries, and now an old project for a railroad along the Caspian Sea could become a reality – another step towards Putin's new world order built around the Global South.

title: US presidential election: Poor employment figures offer last-minute ammunition
summary: The US economy created just 12,000 jobs in October, with a slump in the private sector linked to the Boeing strike and hurricanes in the southeast. The Trump camp took the opportunity to criticize the record of Biden and Harris.

title: US presidential election: The resistance of Republican never-Trumpers
summary: For conservatives opposed to Donald Trump, the GOP's only hope for recovery is another electoral defeat for the candidate on November 5.

title: COP16: Colombia, which advocates for 'peace with nature,' is the deadliest country for environmentalists
summary: Activists from indigenous and farming communities who live in regions marked by the presence of armed groups, extractive activities and trafficking are the main victims of assassinations.

title: Floods in Spain: 'If global warming continues at its current rate, many areas of the Mediterranean will be uninhabitable'
summary: In an op-ed for 'Le Monde,' geographer Magali Reghezza warns of major risks posed by climate inaction: Each additional tenth of a degree exponentially increases hydroclimatic extremes.

title: Macron 'acknowledges' France responsible for 1957 assassination of Algerian nationalist Larbi Ben M'hidi
summary: The young political-military leader of the National Liberation Front was hanged on the night of March 3, 1957, during the Battle of Algiers, by French soldiers who disguised the death of this 'national hero' as a suicide.

title: Trump and Harris hold dueling rallies in battleground Wisconsin amid tense four-day countdown to US Election Day
summary: Wisconsin is part of the Democrats' 'blue wall' across the Midwest, but the region could go either way. The other path to victory could run through southern and western 'Sun Belt' swing states, where Trump and Harris both campaigned Thursday.

title: Devastation in Paiporta, at the epicenter of Spain's floods: 'Dozens of people saved lives all around here'
summary: The city on the southern outskirts of Valencia was devastated by a sudden wave of mud almost 2 meters high, on the night of October 29. At least 62 people perished. Tales of tragedy and acts of courage intertwine in a community in a state of shock.

title: Spain flood death toll climbs to 205 as residents call for aid
summary: The Spanish weather agency issued alerts for strong rains in other regions: Tarragona, Catalonia, as well as part of the Balearic Islands.

title: In the West Bank, a bitter olive harvest, with settlers looming
summary: East of Ramallah, the village of Burqa lives in fear of being attacked by Jewish extremists whose illegal settlements are expanding. Now that the harvest season has begun, incidents are increasingly frequent throughout the occupied territory.

title: US announces new Middle East military deployments in warning to Iran
summary: The additional resources build on previous US defense deployments to the Middle East in support of Israel, including a THAAD missile defense system deployed to the country late last month, operated by American troops on the ground.

title: Flooding in Spain: A controversial trade-off between public safety and economic interests
summary: The disaster in the Valencia region brings back to the forefront a controversy that took place in Madrid in September 2023. At the time, the region's president issued a maximum alert for rainfall that ultimately fell far from the capital. Conservative politicians had criticized her and the meteorological services.

title: North Korea says it will stand by Russia until 'victory' in Ukraine
summary: The North Korean foreign minister was in Moscow as the West believes up to 10,000 North Korean troops are training in Russia and on the brink of entering the war in Ukraine.

title: Morocco rights activist freed but still faces prosecution
summary: Fouad Abdelmoumni, a member of the Alliance of the Left Federation party, was detained following a Facebook post referencing Morocco's alleged spying on France in 2021, in which he alleged Rabat had used Israeli-made Pegasus spyware for espionage against Paris, according to local media.

title: In Lebanon, the war plunges vulnerable migrants into terror
summary: Migrants from the Philippines, Sri Lanka, South Sudan and Sierra Leone have been forced to flee their homes in exposed areas or abandoned by their employers. They have few options for finding shelter or leaving Lebanon.

title: 'The Diplomat' season 2: The White House comes to the embassy
summary: Allison Janney joins Keri Russell in the cast of the spy series released just days before the US presidential election.

title: In photos: The waters of the Colorado River, a political issue
summary: From the western United States to northwestern Mexico, American photographer John Trotter has been documenting the consequences of the river's dramatic decline for the past 20 years.

title: Spain's deadly flash floods in images
summary: Videos from Spain show devastated towns and residents in shock.

title: How Le Monde has covered race in the US
summary: When Le Monde was founded 80 years ago, it quickly picked up on racism in the United States as a key issue to watch. In its early days, the newspaper denounced segregation, while using offensive language to talk about Black Americans.

title: In 1968, near Naples, arte povera was born, a revolutionary and festive moment
summary: Amalfi, October 1968. The Italian art critic Germano Celant invited a group of young artists to the Mediterranean coast, where their works in wood, straw or canvas were a real eye-opener. Their work, which he dubbed 'arte povera,' broke all the codes. These three days launched the careers of these visual artists, to whom the Bourse de Commerce in Paris is devoting an exhibition.

title: Lebanon accuses Israel of rejecting truce after Beirut strikes kill 52: health ministry
summary: Lebanon's health ministry said 52 people were killed and 72 wounded in Israeli strikes on Friday in the country's eastern Baalbek-Hermel region, attacks for which the Israeli army had not issued evacuation warnings.

title: The French companies betting on India: 'The India of today is the China of 20 years ago'
summary: Strong, sustainable growth, a gigantic mass of consumers, including a 100 million with strong purchasing power. The world's most populous country is increasingly attracting French entrepreneurs, large and small. But the market remains difficult to access, padlocked by monopolies.

title: Former US cop convicted of civil rights abuse in Breonna Taylor case
summary: The deaths of Taylor, 26, and George Floyd, a 46-year-old Black man who was murdered by a white police officer in Minneapolis in May 2020, became the focus of a wave of mass protests in the United States and beyond against racial injustice and police brutality.

title: UNESCO reports surge in journalist killings
summary: Between 2022 and 2023, 162 journalists were killed, nearly half of them working in countries experiencing armed conflict.

title: Shootout in western France leaves five teenagers wounded
summary: Five teenagers were hit by gunfire in Poitiers on Thursday evening. One of them, aged 15, has been declared brain-dead. A suspect, believed to be involved in drug trafficking, is being sought.

title: For over a month, France has had no European commissioner
summary: Since Thierry Breton's September resignation, France's seat at the European Commission has been vacant, and will remain so until Stéphane Séjourné succeeds him, in December. Some see this unprecedented situation as a sign of waning influence.

title: Flooding in Spain: Engulfed in mud, shock and agony, the town of Chiva unites in show of solidarity
summary: In Chiva, one of the worst-affected towns of the flooding in Valencia that claimed at least 200 lives, a year's worth of rain fell on Tuesday, causing unimaginable damage. The search for survivors is proving difficult, but an impressive show of solidarity is taking shape as residents prepare for the aftermath.

title: Kemi Badenoch elected new leader of UK Conservative party
summary: The 'anti-woke' candidate was announced as the replacement for Rishi Sunak on Saturday.

title: Paris Masters: No stopping Ugo Humbert, back in the limelight
summary: Having eliminated Carlos Alcaraz, the 26-year-old French tennis player qualified for his first Masters semi-final on Friday, beating Australian Jordan Thompson (6-2, 7-6).

title: Portugal's shoe valley is moving upmarket
summary: In a deteriorating economic climate, Europe's second-largest footwear producer is counting on on the modernization of its industry and its expansion into luxury goods to withstand competition from Asia.

title: Ten Parisian bistros where you can really relax
summary: You can enjoy home cooking and raise a glass with friends, in a warm atmosphere and at very reasonable prices. Here are 10 Paris bistros where you want to linger... and return!

title: Clint Eastwood's art of questioning the essence of the Hollywood hero
summary: In recent years, the American director's films have been inspired by real-life events, depicting the achievements of individuals, who are transformed into heroes by contemporary showmanship.

title: 2024 US presidential election: Latinas on the front line of the fight against Trump in Arizona
summary: Mobilized 10 years ago against anti-migrant Republican plans, Hispanic activists have climbed the local political ladder and are now at the forefront of Kamala Harris's commitment.

title: COP16 biodiversity ends without agreement on funding roadmap to rescue nature
summary: Negotiations were suspended on Saturday morning after negotiations overran and some delegates had to leave to catch flights.

title: In India, a second life for saris
summary: In the suburbs of Mumbai, I Was A Sari has been employing hundreds of underprivileged women for the past 10 years, making new, contemporary pieces for an international audience from used fabrics.

title: Kemi Badenoch, a right-wing politician with no time for 'wokism,' is the new leader of the British Conservatives
summary: Representing the right wing of the party, accustomed to controversial comments, the 44-year-old is tasked with turning around a party weakened by its historic defeat in the July elections.

title: The French culture minister, a cathedral and its holy hams
summary: Rachida Dati must decide if hams will still be allowed to hang in a tower in this religious building in the Cantal region of southcentral France. It's a bizarre story that questions the relationship between the church, the rural world and the French administration.
